intro: Skimmia lutchuensis, commonly known as the Lutchu skimmia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Lutchu (Lushan) in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Rhizophoraceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and humid conditions. Its ornamental value is appreciated in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation. Skimmia lutchuensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for native fauna.
